intro: Calothamnus preissii, commonly known as the yellow devil, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height, and it is adapted to the dry, arid conditions of its native habitat. Calothamnus preissii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
